items.content: 1. Read the story introduction on the first page of the book, and the back cover. What do you know about Mary Lennox? For each sentence choose Yes or No

prompt.body: 2. She moves to a large house in Yorkshire
4. Both she and Ben Weatherstaff are bad-tempered
5. She often cries in the night

items.content: 2. Why is the garden locked? Choose one of these ideas

content.body: There is a dangerous animal inside it

items.content: Read Chapter 1. Who said this, and to whom? What, or who, were they talking about?

prompt.body: 1. I ll hit her when she comes back!

values.value: Mary to herself, about her Indian servant, Kamala.

content.body: Mary to herself, about her Indian servant, Kamala.

values.value: A young Englishman to Mary’s mother, about the disease that was killing so many people in the town.

content.body: A young Englishman to Mary's mother, about the disease that was killing so many people in the town.

prompt.body: 3. It s the child, the one nobody ever sew!

values.value: Another Englishman to his friend, about Mary when they found her alone in her parents’ house.

content.body: Another Englishman to his friend, about Mary when they found her alone in her parents' house.

prompt.body: 4. He s got a crooked back, and he s horrid!

values.value: A young boy called Basil to Mary, about her uncle in Yorkshire, Mr Craven.

content.body: A young boy called Basil to Mary, about her uncle in Yorkshire, Mr Craven.

prompt.body: 5. You must stay out of this wat.

values.value: Mrs Medlock, Mr Craven’s housekeeper, to Mary, about Mr Craven.

content.body: Mrs Medlock, Mr Craven's housekeeper, to Mary, about Mr Craven.

values.value: Mary to herself, about the frightening sound of the wind blowing across the wild Yorkshire moor.

content.body: Mary to herself, about the frightening sound of the wind blowing across the wild Yorkshire moor.

prompt.body: 1. Who was going to clean Mary s room and bring her food?

content.body: Mary's uncle, Mr Craven, because his wife had died after an accident in the garden.

prompt.body: 2. Who sometimes rode a wild horse on the moor

content.body: Martha Sowerby, one of the servants
Mary's uncle, Mr Craven, because his wife had died after an accident in the garden.
